caption.p: Antiprotozan and other therapeutic effects of ursonic acid (UNA). UNA has the potential to treat various human diseases. UNA shows antiprotozoan effects in Leishmania mexicana, Trypanosoma cruzi, Acanthamoeba Castellanii Neff, Acanthamoeba Griffini, Trichomonas vaginalis, and Plasmodium falciparum. UNA also has the possibility of improving hyperglycemia via inhibition of α-glycosidase and glycogen phosphorylase and stimulation of glucose transporter type 4. UNA also exhibits anti-inflammatory effects, such as reduction of nitric oxide, and inhibits rat paw edema. In addition, antiblood-coagulating effects of UNA are also reported. UNA is predicted to strongly bind with nsp15, indicating that UNA may inhibit the metabolism of SARS-CoV-2. UNA also exerts inhibitory effects in herpes simplex type I and II and Epstein–Barr viruses. Moreover, antioxidant activities of UNA are documented. Other bioactivities, including inhibition of human carboxylesterase 1 and biofilm formation of Staphylococcus aureus, are also reported.
